Name: Dirty Banana
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
30 ml De Kuyper Crème de Cafe
30 ml Giffard Banane du Brésil liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Poco grande glass .
BLEND all ingredients with 12oz scoop crushed ice.
Garnish with banana slice on rim.
Review: A rum-laced banana milkshake dirtied by coffee liqueur. The riper the banana used in this cocktail, the better. (Brown spots on the banana skin = tasty cocktail.) This cocktail makes for a filling dessert, so consider splitting this recipe between two 10oz Highball glasses and sharing with a friend. Or for a smaller single-serve: Dirty Banana (half-sized recipe) Glass: Highball (6oz - 10oz /18cl - 30cl) Garnish: Banana chunk on rim Method: BLEND all ingredients with half 6oz scoop crushed ice. 30ml (1oz) Light rum (mellow white/gold 1-3 year old) 15ml (½oz) Coffee liqueur 15ml (½oz) Crème de banana 30ml (1oz) Single cream/half-and-half 1/2 fresh Banana (peeled)
History: A popular cocktail in Jamaica where we discovered this cocktail in the 1990s.
